intro: Arctotis lessingiana, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and grayish-green in color. Arctotis lessingiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
